context.problem: Establish consistent project structure and naming conventions for the imaimai-ui component registry

decision.summary: Use feature-based directory organization with kebab-case directories and PascalCase component files
decision.details: The project follows a feature-based organization where components are organized by their role: registry (public components), docs (documentation components), shared (common UI elements), and ui (shadcn/ui base components). Directory names use kebab-case while component files use PascalCase to match the component name.

alternatives.reason: Would become unmaintainable as the number of components grows
Less intuitive for component registry use case

decision.rationale: Feature-based organization provides clear separation of concerns and makes it easy to locate files. The naming convention follows React and Next.js community standards.
consequences: Easy to locate components by feature

examples.description: Public registry component with kebab-case file name
Documentation component in kebab-case directory with PascalCase file
